Job Title: Specialist - Protein Engineering

Location: Rahway, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

The Protein Engineering group, part of the Chemical Biotechnologies organization of Enabling Technologies Process Research & Development, in Rahway, New Jersey is seeking a Specialist to expand our capabilities to design and engineer proteins with novel functions.  The mission of the group is to engineer enzymes for use as biocatalysts to synthesize APIs and to engineer proteins, peptides, and/or nucleic acids as therapeutics and vaccines.  We view protein engineering as a key enabling technology in modern drug discovery and development.  We leverage computational modeling, advanced automation, and high-throughput screening to engineer novel proteins.  We are committed to developing new methodologies and technologies that enhance protein engineering and improve human health.  The group collaborates broadly within our Company, with academic leaders, and with industry partners to expand and accelerate the impact of protein engineering on human health.

In This Role, The Candidate Will

Identify and solve problems in the context of Protein Engineering laboratory operations and automation, identify opportunities to improve operational and/or scientific excellence, collaborate with stakeholders to propose, fund, acquire or develop, and implement improvements. Design, construct, modify, calibrate, operate, and maintain equipment used for Protein Engineering research and development. Confer with principal scientific researchers concerning the specific objectives and broad approach required to carry out research. Modify, refine, adapt, or develop laboratory techniques and analytical procedures to meet specific experimental goals. Leverage strong working knowledge of theories, practices, and procedures in Protein Engineering to optimize workflows. Participate in capital planning. Maintain a safe and compliant laboratory environment. Ensure business continuity through training of group staff, maintenance and upgrading of equipment, equipment vendor and service provider relationship management, facilities and IT relationship management, and stocking of related consumable supplies and parts. Learn the needs of Chemical Biotechnologies team and projects and drive innovative improvements in operational and scientific excellence in Protein Engineering workflows through team and individual work. Train Protein Engineering staff on new and existing equipment use. Build relationships within Chemical Biotechnologies, facilities, safety, and vendors. Future-proof operations and analytics by staying abreast of cutting-edge advances in methodology and equipment relevant to Protein Engineering workflows through scientific literature, network, and other resources Review literature to keep abreast of cutting-edge methodology in Protein Engineering and automation. Apply knowledge of business challenges to improve processes, for example acceleration and automation of protein engineering workflows and improve data capture and management. 

Minimum Requirements

B.S. with 3 years of experience or M.S. in Chemistry, Engineering, Biology, Bioengineering, or a related field (with expected graduation no later than June 2024). Experience in field-impacting research or development in which the applicant participated in the execution, and analysis of the research or development.Significant expertise in one of the following: analytical instrumentation, liquid handling automation, sample management. Demonstrated ability to work within a collaborative multi-disciplinary team environment. Excellent communication and organizational skills. 

Preferred Experience And Skills

Familiarity with one or more of the following areas are highly desired: next-generation sequencing, automation, protein expression, machine learning, and/or microfluidics. Experience with reproducible data analysis, for example using Python or R. Experience or knowledge in laboratory aut
